citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, three of the wooden perches (one high in the enclosure and two below it) in the blue-and-
gold macaw enclosure (housing 2 blue-and-gold macaws) were in a deteriorated condition. The perches were made of
wooden boards and all three of them appeared to have been chewed on by the macaws, leaving the perching side of the
board looking roughened and splintered. The roughened edges of the perches extended the entire length of the boards
and lowered the edge of the boards approximately 1 to 4 inches from their original cut edge.
Damaged wooden surfaces cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized. This increases the risk of exposing the birds to
disease and organisms that can be harmful to their health and well-being.
Primary enclosures must be kept in good repair to ensure that all surfaces in contact with the birds can be readily cleaned
and sanitized or replaced when worn or soiled.
To be corrected by close of business on 7/23/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
